page.title: 02GROWTH OF HOOK
page.content: Hook is one of the settlements designated in the Hampshire Structure Plan as being suitable for growth. Land is being developed in Hook to the East of the A32 and further land between the A32 and A30. Further development is constrained to the south by Bartley Heath, a large area of common land. To the west and north, large scale development would affect an area of important landscape, be visually intrusive, could result in the coalescence of Hook and other neighburing settlements and would cause congestion on minor roads. To the north east development would be a clearly visible intrusion into the open countryside.Three future options for development are set out in a draft plan soon to be available for public inspection.Hart Council's preference is for expansion north of the A30.
